Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of Internal Flight Alternative (IFA) finding
Evidence_Type: Personal testimony, country condition reports, mental health records
Legal_Provision: Section 97(1) of IRPA – Cessation and exclusion clauses
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution by non-state actor (Mara 18 gang)
Evaluation_Standard: Reasonableness standard under the Dunsmuir framework
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Claimant's mental health, lack of family support, high crime in proposed IFA locations
Application_Error: Failure to properly assess reasonableness of IFA for specific claimant
Review_Outcome: Decision set aside and remitted to a differently constituted panel
Evidence_Ignored: Fragile mental health, lack of social support, economic vulnerability
Legal_Standard: Viable IFA must be both factually possible and reasonable
Application_Factor: Claimant’s age, education level, trauma history, local conditions in El Salvador
Decision_Outcome: Original refugee claim dismissed due to alleged viable IFA
Decision_Review_Issue: Unreasonable determination of internal flight alternative
Cause_of_Refusal: Alleged availability of a viable internal flight alternative
Procedural_Fairness: Deficient reasoning affecting fairness of process
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on unreasonableness and procedural fairness
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Charter of Rights and Freedoms (indirectly)
Procedural_Issue: Inadequate reasons provided for IFA determination
Omission_Type: Failure to consider personal circumstances of claimant
